Conduit Sagas.desc: This deck focuses on using [[Power Conduit]] along with [[Chainer's Torment]] to repeatedly drain life from your opponents. [[The Eldest Reborn]] is another way for [[Power Conduit]] to be abused, while cards such as [[Ill-Gotten Inheritance]], [[Defiant Bloodlord]], and [[Agent of Masks]] assist in the draining.

Gates.desc: A 5-color battle deck? Yessir! This deck uses 22 guildgates (such as [[Azorius Guildgate]]) and takes advantage of them with [[Gatebreaker Ram]], [[Gate Colossus]], [[Guild Summit]], and [[Archway Angel]].

Golgari Sherei.desc: This deck focuses around using [[Shirei, Shizo's Caretaker]] to generate lots of value with cards like [[Sakura-Tribe Elder]], [[Deep Forest Hermit]], and [[Elvish Visionary]]. Bringing these cards back over and over with Sherei's ability and sacrificing to themselves or to [[Bloodthrone Vampire]] allows for an engine that's bound to take over the game. Also, [[Fecundity]] because [[Fecundity]].

Flicker Drake.desc: This combo / light control deck seeks to combo off with [[Peregrine Drake]], [[Ghostly Flicker]], and [[Archaeomancer]]. These three generate infinte mana, allowing you to draw your deck with [[Sea Gate Oracle]], the make everyone else lose with [[Blue Sun's Zenith]].

Midnight Gond Combo.desc: Do you like tokens? How about a lot of tokens? This deck aims to make all the tokens you can dream of with [[Presence of Gond]] attached to [[Midnight Guard]]. Use [[Commune with the Gods]] to get there and [[Soul Warden]] to get loads of life from your tokens hitting the field.

Izzet Weenies.desc: This deck revolves around the card [[Cavalcade of Calamity]]. Play a bunch of small dispensable creatures ([[Dragon Fodder]], [[Goblin Gathering]]) or hard to block boys ([[Ornithopter]], [[Slither Blade]]) and swing in.

Simic Superfriends.desc: You heard me right - thanks to War of the Spark, 10$ superfriends is a thing. [[Jiang Yanggu, Wildcrafter]], [[Vraska, Swarm's Eminence]], [[Arlinn, Voice of the Pack]], and (if you're lucky) [[Nissa, Voice of Zendikar]] do some work. Proliferate effects such as [[Thrummingbird]] keep your Planeswalkers going and [[Mowu, Loyal Companion]] just might be enough to topple your opponent's life total.

Simic Ascendancy.desc: Opponent seems to have a million life? Or maybe they really do? Who cares! [[Simic Ascendancy]] sure doesn't. Play cards that give themselves counters like [[Chronomaton]] and [[Heroes' Bane]], ramp with [[New Horizons]], and hope you gret the copy of [[Wilderness Reclamation]] to end the game without ever touching your opponent's life total.

Selesnya Enchantress.desc: Out-value your oppoenents in this Enchantress deck. With 8 [[Satyr Enchanter]] type effects, you're bound to hit your [[Starfield Mystic]] and [[Sigil of the Empty Throne]] to start pumping out more angels than you can count.

Saproling Swarm.desc: Time to chuck out a bunch of 1/1s with this Saproling deck. Early game, use [[Saproling Migration]] and [[Yavimaya Sapherd]] to get started. Later, hope for [[Arcane Melee]] and [[Memory Crystal]] to let you cast [[Whispers of the Muse]] and [[Sprout Swarm]] over and over and over, running over your opponent with an army of small plants.

Golgari Desecrated Tomb.desc: What? [[Desecrated Tomb]]. How? [[Reassembling Skeleton]] and [[Bloodsoaked Champion]] as the conduits, [[Culling Dais]] and [[Bloodflow Connoisseur]] to keep doing it. Make a bunch of bats, swing in for lots of damage. If you need more lands or more creatures,  [[Evolutionary Leap]] and [[Perilous Forays]] are your friends.

Dimir Ninjas.desc: Become one with your stealthy side and play the ninja deck at the table. [[Slither Blade]] or [[Ornithopter]] on turn one, then [[Ingenious Infiltrator]] the next turn to start drawing cards. [[Fallen Shinobi]] to... borrow... your opponent's cards, then [[Ninja of the New Moon]] to deal massive damage.

Barely Blue Myr Mirrorworks Combo.desc: Possibly the most convuluted deck on this page, this beautiful deck that has almost no color in it shines bright with its Myr. [[Mirrorworks]] is the most fun card in this deck. The rest of the combo consists of [[Myr Galvanizer]], [[Palladium Myr]], [[Thermal Navigator]], and [[Workshop Assistant]]. There's another combo that uses [[Powerstone Shard]]. Not going to explain everything on here, if you can figure it out, good for you!

Mono-Blue Mystic Forge.desc: This artifact deck makes use of M20's [[Mystic Forge]]. Play this, Reduce artifact costs with [[Etherium Sculptor]], Make a bunch of tokens with [[Efficient Construction]] and [[Golem Foundry]], gain a bunch of life with [[Golem's Heart]], then do it all again with an [[Elixir of Immortality]].

Dictate Pingers.desc: Warning: This deck could be very bad but also hilarious. Aiming to play cards that tap to deal damage, such as [[Goblin Fireslinger]] and [[Vent Sentinel]], defend with walls for [[Vent Sentinel]] such as [[Fog Bank]], and play [[Dictate of the Twin Gods]] and pray that your damage output can beat your opponents.

Mono-White Soul Sisters.desc: At the heart of this deck lies [[Soul Warden]] with a helping hand in [[Ajani's Welcome]] and [[Anointer Priest]]. Play a bunch of small creatures and tokens with [[Battle Screech]], [[Raise the Alarm]], and [[Doomed Traveler]], gain a lot of life with [[Angel of Vitality]], draw cards with [[Mentor of the Meek]], beat face. The end.

Dimir Amassing Wizards.desc: Wizards are a meddling bunch, and you love them. Get out your star player, [[Naban, Dean of Iteration]], and then throw down [[Aether Adept]] and [[Exclusion Mage]] to clear the way for your [[Gleaming Overseer]] and [[Vizier of the Scorpion]]'s abomination. [[Riverwise Augur]], [[Pondering Mage]], and [[Azami, Lady of Scrolls]] keep your hand filled with cards while your opponents weep at your power.

Approach of the Sunbird.desc: The point of this deck is to cast [[Sunbird's Invocation]] and then [[Approach of the Second Sun]], thus winning you the game. Get lots of mana with a pile of mana rocks, getting you to the spells listed above or, if you can't hit those, a couple of [[Ulamog's Crusher]]s should be enough to end your opponent's misery as well.
